meanings.definition: Relating to or denoting the system of geometry based on the work of Euclid, especially the postulates of plane geometry.
meanings.sent1: The students studied the euclidean shapes in their geometry class.
meanings.sent2: The euclidean principles are fundamental in understanding plane geometry.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to chase its euclidean shadow on the ground.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a euclidean maze of interconnected ideas.
meanings.sent5: The euclidean patterns on the wallpaper mesmerized the guests.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to Euclid or his work.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed ancient euclidean manuscripts.
meanings.sent2: Euclidean scholars often refer to the works of Euclid.
meanings.sent3: The chef's recipe was a euclidean recreation of Euclid's favorite dish.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to the euclidean teachings was unwavering.
meanings.sent5: The euclidean artifacts in the exhibit fascinated the visitors.
